Posts.Content: Hi Mechele, for a start its blooming cold in bed without hair, I used a bed-cap, nothing particularly special but then, it didn't bother me to loose my hair if it meant I was still around.  I am sure you can buy the old fashioned lace cotton caps, which would look lovely on you I'm sure. just a thought, big hugs,
Posts.Title: I'm not 'me'

Posts.Content: Hi all, I found diluting the mouthwashes helped until I got the balance right. And a soft headed electric toothbrush ☺️. this is my first post, wonderful site and so pleased to meet you all! shirley
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Thanks Dreamthief, i think compared with others on the site I've got off relatively lightly, I never realised how complex the mix of primary and secondary cancers were. i shouldn't have been so dismissive of the new side effects, they change every time and last week were a bit grim, my bilirubin and liver markers were better last week and I see my onchologist this friday so should get a better idea of the new plan or if it continues without the irinotecan. all the best to everyone.
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Good luck Katherine, my son and daughter are both taking part,running on behalf of Macmillan, they have also reached their targets, I am so proud of them.  Time doesn't matter it's taking part that counts and raising funds for Macmillan of course. all the very best. shirley
Posts.Title: great north run
